title: Google Maps nudity ban flouted as couple pictured getting frisky in public
text:
Sometimes the moment just takes you (Google Maps)

Google Maps has caught the moment a couple in Taiwan decided to have a little fun in public – despite the platform’s strict nudity ban.

The amourous couple were snapped with their clothes off by the side of the road by one of Google’s roving Street View cars.

Their secret may never have been uncovered were it not for an eagle-eyed Google Maps user who spotted the naughty couple.

It appears they may have been in the middle of a steamy sex session by the side of a mountain road. However, it’s impossible to know when the photo was taken as Google has been scouring the planet for several years to build up its Maps application.

The couple were pictured by the side of the Shantian Road in Taichung, Taiwan and will no doubt cause Google Maps bosses a bit of embarrassment.

The naked couple were caught having some fun on the side of the road (AsiaWire / Google Maps)

The company cracked down on nudity on Google Maps after an incident last year – also in Taiwan – where a woman flashed her breasts by the side of the road.

The images quickly went viral and forced Google to step in and take them down.

They didn’t know they were being captured on Google Street View (AsiaWire / Google Maps)

If you were just driving by, you might not suspect anything (AsiaWire / Google Maps)

The footage caused excitement with residents joking they were driving to the village ‘straight away’.

One said: ‘I’ve never thought about going there but now I want to. It definitely seems like a lively area.’

Another added: ‘Let’s drive there now. It seems like there’s a special surprise waiting.’

Pinge Road become one of the top searched places in the region. Internet users bombarded the obscure location with five star reviews before the naughty video was reported to Google bosses.

The couple were snapped on a mountain road on the outskirts of Taichung, Taiwan (AsiaWire / Google Maps)

‘Users can refer to Google’s content policy instructions to understand what content is prohibited and restricted, such as not allowing pornography, explicit or sexually suggestive content,’ said a dour Google spokesperson at the time.

These new images have caused similar excitement online.

A social media user who spotted the couple – who have yet to be identified – said: ‘I took a look on Google to see whether I’d find some animals, and unexpectedly came across this wonderful sight!’
